'''Meetings''' || 33 |- | style="vertical-align: top;" | '''All-time series''' || Atlanta leads 21â12 |- |- ! style="background: #E0E7EF;" colspan="2" | Championship Success |- | colspan="2"|'''[[History of NFL Championships|Super Bowl Championships]] (0)''' '''[[List of National Football League seasons|Conference Championships]] (2)''' * '''ATL''' (1) â [[1998 NFL season|1998]] * '''CAR''' (1) â [[2003 NFL season|2003]] '''Division Championships (8)''' * '''ATL''' (4) â [[1980 NFL season|1980]], [[1998 NFL season|1998]], [[2004 NFL season|2004]], [[2010 NFL season|2010]] * '''CAR''' (4) â [[1996 NFL season|1996]], [[2003 NFL season|2003]], [[2005 NFL season|2005]], [[2008 NFL season|2008]] |} The '''I-85 Rivalry''' is a [[National Football League rivalries|rivalry]] between the [[Atlanta Falcons]] and the [[Carolina Panthers]] of the [[National Football League]]. Both franchises have a combined eight divisional titles (seven as members of the same division) and two [[Super Bowl]] appearances, with the Falcons appearing in [[Super Bowl XXXIII]] and the Panthers appearing in [[Super Bowl XXXVIII]]. The rivalry takes its name from [[Atlanta]] and [[Charlotte]] (home of the Panthers) being only four to five hours apart on [[Interstate 85]]. The Panthers and Falcons have played each other twice a season every season since {{nfly|1995}}, as both members of the [[NFC West]] and the [[NFC South]] divisions. Their games have been marked by intensity, close scores, and remarkable performances. In the [[National Basketball Association]], the moniker is used to refer to games played between the [[Atlanta Hawks]] and [[Charlotte Bobcats]], who also enjoy an intense rivalry of their own; the Hawks were also onetime rivals of the [[Charlotte Hornets (NBA)|Charlotte Hornets]] from 1988 until 2002, when the Hornets relocated to [[New Orleans]]. The rivalry largely mirrors the bitter rivalry between the cities of Charlotte and Atlanta. ==Beginning== Carolina's first ever regular season game was a 23â20 overtime loss against the Falcons on September 3, 1995. Later that season, Carolina went on to defeat Atlanta 21â17 for their seventh win of the year---the most ever for an expansion franchise.[http://www.nflplayers.com/news/news_release.aspx?id=5520 In Panthers- Falcons Rivalry, Dislike Runs Deep On Both Sides] from Associated press, posted 8 September, 2006. ==Game results== {| class="wikitable" |bgcolor="#CCFFFF"|'''[[NFL playoffs|Post Season
